activities.loc: JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan S Petit

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2022 at 08:45 am.

10:07 AM Defendant Nathan S Petit appeared by video, in custody at Washburn County Jail.  Attorney Kaitlin Elizabeth Dippolito in court for Nathan S Petit.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Dippolito relates Defendant qualifies for Public Defender and she will represent.  Time limits not waived.  Preliminary hearing set within 20 days and may appear by Zoom.  Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:58 AM Defendant Nathan S Petit appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Qualified for PD, no counsel yet. 
Attorney Rockow advises counsel should be appointed next week.
Court resets.
Next hearing to be in person. 
Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report

10:27 AM Defendant Nathan S Petit appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant state he called the Public Defender's office and they state he qualifies but is not appointed one yet.
Bond continues.
Next hearing to be in front of Judge Boyle.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:05 PM Defendant Nathan S Petit appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Nathan S Petit (for today only).  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Nathan S Petit. Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
